dt: {bc}one who reveals something covert or who informs against another
{bc}an employee who brings wrongdoing by an employer or by other employees to the attention of a government or law enforcement agency
A whistleblower is commonly protected legally from retaliation.

dt.t: I think {wi}whistleblowers{/wi} play a hugely important role in countering the worst corporate and government excesses.
… pledges to protect {wi}whistle-blowers{/wi} who fear reprisals for their efforts.

Congress also added significant new protection for {wi}whistleblowers{/wi}. The 1986 act provides remedies including reinstatement, back-pay with interest, and, as appropriate, punitive damages for {wi}whistleblowers{/wi} who are discharged, demoted, or discriminated against due to involvement with a False Claims disclosure.

utxt.t: Many states have already enacted laws that protect {wi}whistle-blowing{/wi} employees from retaliation.
… a National Security Agency agent who got in trouble for {wi}whistle-blowing{/wi}.

shortdef: one who reveals something covert or who informs against another; especially : an employee who brings wrongdoing by an employer or by other employees to the attention of a government or law enforcement agency
